message: Late Show host David Letterman publicly reveals that he was the target of a $2 million extortion attempt related to his past relationships with staff members.
President Barack Obama signs an executive order banning federal employees from texting while driving on government business or using government-owned vehicles.
The United Kingdom's newly created Supreme Court officially opens, transferring judicial power from the House of Lords to an independent body for the first time.
China celebrates the 60th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic with a massive military parade and patriotic displays in Beijing's Tiananmen Square.
In Venezuela, over 150 university students end a hunger strike after meeting with human rights officials and securing the release of a detained protest leader.
The Minnesota Twins defeat the Detroit Tigers 8–3, keeping their postseason hopes alive as the American League Central race tightens.
Manager Tony La Russa marks his 4,770th game managed in Major League Baseball, surpassing John McGraw for second-most in MLB history.
Seattle Mariners' Ichiro Suzuki reaches 220 hits for the season, becoming the first MLB player to accomplish five 220-hit seasons.
Veteran shortstop Orlando Cabrera hits the first grand slam of his career, helping propel the Twins to a critical win in the playoff chase.
Washington Capitals' star Alexander Ovechkin opens the NHL season with two goals and an assist in a 4–1 victory over the Boston Bruins.
Before the Colorado Avalanche's season opener, the team retires longtime captain Joe Sakic's jersey number 19 in an emotional pregame ceremony.
The Indiana Fever tie the WNBA Finals 1–1 by defeating the Phoenix Mercury 93–84 in Game 2, led by Tamika Catchings' strong performance.
NASA releases satellite imagery of Typhoon Parma as it moves toward the Philippines, highlighting the storm’s development and projected path.
London Mayor Boris Johnson makes a surprise cameo on the British soap opera EastEnders, appearing in a lighthearted market scene.
The Colorado Rockies clinch a National League Wild Card berth after defeating the Milwaukee Brewers 9–2, securing their spot in the postseason.
The Houston Astros top the Philadelphia Phillies 5–3 in a late-season matchup with little playoff implication but strong individual performances.
The St. Louis Cardinals dominate the Cincinnati Reds 13–0, highlighted by a grand slam and six RBIs from pitcher Chris Carpenter.
Ichiro Suzuki sets a new Major League Baseball record with five seasons of 220 or more hits, continuing his streak of elite consistency.
The Montreal Canadiens defeat the Toronto Maple Leafs 4–3 in overtime during the NHL’s opening night, thrilling fans with a dramatic finish.
The Calgary Flames edge out the Vancouver Canucks 5–3 in a high-paced NHL season opener that featured aggressive play and solid goaltending.
The Colorado Avalanche surprise the San Jose Sharks with a 5–2 victory on opening night, setting the tone for their new season.
